channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 根据新规定，iPhone 制造商将开放其利润丰厚的应用程序生态系统的部分内容，为谷歌等竞争对手提供了机会。
item.description:
Under the new rules, the iPhone maker will open up parts of its lucrative app ecosystem, providing an opportunity for rivals like Google https://t.co/1sn7P97MJ2 https://t.co/1sn7P97MJ2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 成立于中国的电子商务折扣店 Temu 是 Meta Platforms 去年收入最高的广告商，也是谷歌五大支出最高的广告商之一。
item.description:
Temu, the e-commerce discounter founded in China, was the top advertiser by revenue at Meta Platforms last year and was among the five top-spending advertisers at Google https://t.co/16e5HqLJ7Y https://t.co/16e5HqLJ7Y

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 看：华尔街日报》分析了该公司的持续增长将如何重新定义行业--就像亚马逊的快速配送竞赛一样。
item.description:
Watch: In just one year, Chinese-founded e-commerce company Temu became the most-downloaded app in the U.S. WSJ breaks down how its continued growth could redefine the industry–just like Amazon’s race for speedy delivery. https://t.co/D9vwg3hn1v https://t.co/D9vwg3hn1v

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 拜登总统的大选年国情咨文是一个充满潜在风险和回报的时刻
item.description:
President Biden’s election-year State of the Union address is a moment loaded with potential risks and rewards https://t.co/iUjMesUCkq https://t.co/iUjMesUCkq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 英国广告监管机构推翻了早些时候做出的禁止 Calvin Klein 一则广告的决定，他们认为该广告将歌手 FKA Twigs 表现为 "刻板的性对象"。
item.description:
U.K. advertising regulators reversed an earlier decision banning a Calvin Klein ad that they had found presented singer FKA Twigs as “a stereotypical sexual object” https://t.co/IAdVAEoiYf https://t.co/IAdVAEoiYf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 租车意味着每天花费高达 80 或 100 美元（如果你能找到一辆车的话）的日子一去不复返了。"这是旅行中为数不多的能让消费者真正享受到价格优惠的领域之一"。
item.description:
Gone are the days where renting a car meant spending upward of $80 or $100 a day—if you could even find a car. “It's one of the few areas in travel where there's actually a little bit of price relief for the consumer.” https://t.co/BjpArAD5jO https://t.co/BjpArAD5jO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 当全世界都在关注加沙战争时，西岸的定居者却在加速修建非法道路和前沿定居点。观看我们对非法定居者建筑的视频调查。
item.description:
While the world focuses on the war in Gaza, settlers in the West Bank have been building illegal roads and outposts at an accelerated pace. Watch our video investigation into illegal settler construction. https://t.co/hBDglR93sd https://t.co/hBDglR93sd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯正在前线沿线的多个地点攻击乌克兰部队，试图利用其最近夺取的东部城市阿夫迪耶夫卡（Avdiivka）。
item.description:
Russia is attacking Ukrainian forces at several points along the front line as it seeks to capitalize on its recent capture of the eastern city of Avdiivka https://t.co/qg8Sb5mmGP https://t.co/qg8Sb5mmGP

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 街头智慧@jmackin2 写道：最近泡沫之说甚嚣尘上，但要说明近期股市涨势在很大程度上是合理的，却并非难事
item.description:
Streetwise: There is a lot of bubble talk lately, but it’s easy to tell a story of how recent stock market gains could be largely justified, writes @jmackin2 https://t.co/CbvKmhKnFC https://t.co/CbvKmhKnFC

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 近代以来，美国从未在两位年龄如此之大、反感如此强烈的总统候选人之间做出选择
item.description:
Never in modern times has America had to choose between two presidential candidates so old and so strongly disliked https://t.co/ooh5ileyQ0 https://t.co/ooh5ileyQ0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 你的同事很差劲，却浑然不知
item.description:
Your co-worker is lousy—and doesn’t even know it https://t.co/l7W5ObIQJK https://t.co/l7W5ObIQJK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 企业正加紧招聘人工智能专业人才，并为人才支付高额薪酬
item.description:
Companies are ramping up recruitment of artificial-intelligence professionals and paying a premium for talent https://t.co/J0MK3MsVcu https://t.co/J0MK3MsVcu

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 从黑帮聚会到摇摆派对，底特律的施维茨澡堂在过去的一个世纪里为许多人提供了热情的服务
item.description:
From gangster gatherings to swinger parties, the Schvitz, a Detroit bathhouse, has provided a warm welcome to many over the last century https://t.co/d5DTBdeNYf https://t.co/d5DTBdeNYf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 一份被称为 "79号文件 "的中国指令扩大了将美国技术挤出中国的驱动力。有人称之为 "Delete A"（删除美国）。
item.description:
A Chinese directive known as Document 79 expands a drive that is muscling U.S. technology out of the country. Some refer to it as “Delete A”—for Delete America. https://t.co/SBOzLGcDSU https://t.co/SBOzLGcDSU

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: Target 正在推出其 Circle 360 付费会员服务。看看它与亚马逊 Prime 的比较。
item.description:
Target is rolling out its Circle 360 paid membership. See how it compares with Amazon Prime. https://t.co/60mQZci5br https://t.co/60mQZci5br

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: "二十年前，奢华意味着与世隔绝。如今，更多的人想要社区"。纽约市建筑师 Eran Chen 的二楼阁楼内。
item.description:
"Twenty years ago luxury meant isolation. Today more people want community." Inside the second-floor loft of New York City architect Eran Chen. https://t.co/uFaLHLhzv0 https://t.co/uFaLHLhzv0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登的新价格打击力量的真正目的不是帮助消费者，而是将价格上涨归咎于企业。这是政治转移。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The real point of Biden’s new price strike force isn’t to help consumers, but to blame business for the price increases. It’s political deflection. https://t.co/jEAouElS5f

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@ConnorPfeiffer 写道：随着符合 USMCA 标准的中国电动汽车可能涌入市场，美国、墨西哥和加拿大都会有所损失，因此应该积极制定联合应对措施。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: With the possibility of USMCA-compliant Chinese EVs flooding the market, the U.S., Mexico and Canada all have something to lose and should be proactive in developing a joint response, writes @ConnorPfeiffer https://t.co/pFc8sUon5M

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 以下是《华尔街日报》头版的早期报道
item.description:
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/oa1S9kVvyb pic.twitter.com/dlMoGNtn1h

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：经过九年和三次总统竞选，特朗普首次在民调中持续领先于他的一位民主党对手。霍尔曼-詹金斯（Holman Jenkins）写道，他可以感谢他的敌人。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: After nine years and three presidential campaigns, Trump for the first time consistently leads one of his Democratic opponents in the polls. He can thank his enemies, writes Holman Jenkins. https://t.co/KwTfWa3dST

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：两大主要政党正在为提名也许是唯一可能输给对方的候选人而努力。这是美国总统不受欢迎程度的大比拼。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The two major parties are marching to nominate perhaps the only candidates who could lose to the other. It’s America’s great presidential unpopularity contest. https://t.co/nnLkIcWkb0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 有些人喜欢赛博特卡车尖锐、锯齿状的未来主义设计。他们会怎么看待......Cybertoiletpaper？请看我们的新漫画。
item.description:
Some people love the Cybertruck’s sharp, jagged, futuristic design. How would they feel about…Cybertoiletpaper? Find out in our new comic strip. https://t.co/k9BSFVBtm5 https://t.co/k9BSFVBtm5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 一家总部位于得克萨斯州的公司可以将您亲人的火化遗体送入轨道、深空或月球。但是，纳瓦霍部落对此表示反对。
item.description:
A Texas-based company can send your loved ones’ cremated remains into orbit, deep space or to the moon. But the Navajo Nation is pushing back. https://t.co/7ae5WzAv3X https://t.co/7ae5WzAv3X

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 华尔街日报》从一艘菲律宾船只的甲板上目睹了中国在南海的恐吓策略
item.description:
The Wall Street Journal witnessed China's tactics of intimidation in the South China Sea, from the deck of a Philippine vessel https://t.co/44xyTJuOLy https://t.co/44xyTJuOLy

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 🎧 听：在今天的《日报》播客中，@Elizacollins1 报道了 "超级星期二 "的结果：特朗普对拜登
item.description:
🎧 Listen: In today's episode of The Journal podcast, @elizacollins1 reports on the Super Tuesday results that set the stage for a rematch nobody wants: Trump vs. Biden https://t.co/0uBLJZ8Lk6 https://t.co/0uBLJZ8Lk6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 看凯文-哈特（Kevin Hart）从卖鞋的小贩做起，走过了漫长的道路。在与 @WSJMag 的 "The One "节目中，哈特谈到了他从喜剧演员成长为娱乐大亨的经历、他要传授给孩子们的东西，以及如何向奥普拉、Jay-Z 和泰勒-佩里学习。
item.description:
Watch: Kevin Hart has come a long way since his days working as a shoe salesman. In The One with @WSJMag, Hart discusses growing from comedian to entertainment mogul, what he’s passing down to his kids, and looking up to Oprah, Jay-Z and Tyler Perry. https://t.co/HGLMFI80Sr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 观看：它来了。能在特斯拉超级充电站为非特斯拉汽车充电的适配器。它能解决电动汽车行业最大的问题之一吗？乔安娜-斯特恩（Joanna Stern）驾驶她的福特野马 Mach-E 跑了 10 个不同的超级充电站，一探究竟。
item.description:
Watch: It’s here. The adapter that will charge non-Teslas at Tesla Superchargers. Does it solve one of the EV industry’s biggest problems? Joanna Stern hit up 10 different Superchargers in her Ford Mustang Mach-E to find out. https://t.co/06dqSgRZgz https://t.co/06dqSgRZgz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 由于燃气壁炉的所有者拒绝牺牲乡村美学来换取方便的生火方式，因此木柴陈列仓库（又称 "木箱"）比以往任何时候都更受欢迎。
item.description:
Firewood display storage—also known as "wood boxes"—is more popular than ever, thanks to gas fireplace owners who refuse to sacrifice rustic aesthetics for the convenience of an easy-start fire https://t.co/0wVXoALtWr https://t.co/0wVXoALtWr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 比弗利伍德原本是中产阶级的一块飞地，但洛杉矶的比弗利伍德社区正在迅速崛起，购房者花费数百万美元在此居住。吸引力何在？
item.description:
Originally an enclave for the middle class, the Los Angeles neighborhood of Beverlywood is blowing up, with buyers spending millions to live there. What's the draw? https://t.co/u4vXTf7LdT https://t.co/u4vXTf7LdT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: "她从不承认自己有问题"一个从成功人士跌落到无家可归的女人 仍然像个百万富翁一样侃侃而谈让她得到帮助似乎是不可能的
item.description:
“She wasn’t ever going to admit she had a problem.” A woman who tumbled from success to homelessness still talked like a millionaire. Getting her help seemed impossible. https://t.co/7U3aJEOzu8 https://t.co/7U3aJEOzu8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024
